video_title: Heâ€™s Physically challenged but still working hard for his sick mom ğŸ˜¢ ğŸ’”
author: @MysticalLibraries
comment:
This video hit me like a ton of bricks. I had a cousin, who was dealing with the exact same condition and it is caused due to polio. He tried taking his life multiple times, left home on many occasions and we found him in a different state. As he continued to become an adult and saw his cousins getting married, he wanted to get married as well. He was adamant and mentally distressed. It was challenging to help him understand the situation or find a wife for him. He eventually took his wheelchair to the train tracks and put an end to his life at the age of 35. 
Since I have seen this situation first hand, it's really distressing for the person in question and their parents. I was very young to understand what his condition was and used to make fun of him. He wanted to run his own business, so his father got him a van and a shop near a temple. His demands kept growing and as well as his jealousy, which we cannot blame him for.
